noun.description: Action or speech that makes someone annoyed or angry, especially deliberately.
examples: you should remain calm and not respond to provocation
he burst into tears at the slightest provocation

noun.description: Testing to elicit a particular response or reflex.
examples: twenty patients had a high increase of serum gastrin after provocation with secretin

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin provocatio(n-), from the verb provocare (see provoke).
